content.description: Left arete on cool lay-backy, bulby holds. Fun v0 warm-up on cool holds with a relatively easy topout. Start on this and Lob first thing in the morning. This is the slightly harder of the two.
content.location: In the Out of the Box area, just about visible from Millipede. Look for a clean face with good holds in the center (Lob), and this problem on the left side.

content.description: Stand start on side pull. Move up and into grooves to top out.
content.location: On the back of the boulder in front of the Millipede boulder. Facing away from Bum Boy. To the right of Orchid on the same face.

content.description: Start on good holds with a high right foot, and shoot straight up through more good stuff until you hit the topout at just 6 feet. Low to medium technical topout, and a safe fall make this a great topout trainer. Good stone.
content.location: Follow the face left around the corner from Ticket Home V0 and Lob V0 to find this chalked up and much loved, if brief, rig. Or find this obvious route facing you as you approach from the main center walking path towards The Middle but keep straight and don't exit right to any corridors.

content.description: Sit start with low slopey pinch. Move out left in back of overhang to tiny crimp. Move up to dishes and more and top out.
content.location: Under a small overhang facing in the direction of the Millipede boulder. If passing the V0's and then the three V2's in this area, keep left.

content.description: Stand start on left hand side pull and right hand sloper. A series of great sloper moves up a featured groove make this problem, tucked away from the main parts of HP, an underrated classic. Sidepull your way up the Bum Boy-like slopers using technical footwork. Stay on direct line to keep it pure.
content.location: Near HP Canyon, on the other side of the boulder that faces Millipede. Walk through the corridor directly away from Millipede and turn right. Orchid is the dark face on the right. Walk off.

content.description: Warm-up! This and Ticket Home are great v0s to get the blood pumping first thing in the morning. Great rock, good movement, good landings. This is the easier of the two. Easy climbing up good jugs on clean rock (last I checked)
content.location: In the Out of the Box Area, which is just about visible when you are standing at Millipede. Look for a 12-14 ft face with good holds.

content.description: Start on slot crack good hold. Move up right and keep traversing right until you can top out this low 4 foot boulder.
content.location: Find it by staying left after ignoring corridors to the flow area, supa coola area, and millipede boulder.

content.description: Positive crimp rail start working left and up to better holds. Difficult mantle.
content.location: Entering the Out of the Box area, look left until you see a crimpy start with a tiny roof of slopey holds protruding above.

content.description: Mostly a collection of several low grade face climbs.
